data.title: Ottawa Citizen
data.meta_description: John Ford passed away. This is the full obituary where you can express condolences and share memories. Published in the Ottawa Citizen on 2010-08-28.
data.text:
FORD, Dr. John H. "Jack" (Retired Pembroke Chiropractor with extensive service to Kiwanis, Masonic Lodge and Shrine, Renfrew County District School Board and Calvin United Church.) Passed away peacefully in hospital with his family by his side on Thursday, August 26, 2010 in his 93rd year. Dr. Jack Ford of Pembroke, beloved husband of Sally Ford (nee MacPherson), and by first marriage the late Marjorie Ford (nee Moore). Dear father of Robert "Bob" Ford (Dawn), Kanata; and Anne Smith (Jack), Lake Dore. Grandfather of David Ford (Allison), Calgary, AB; Margaret-Anne Falconer (Matthew), Bath; Tammara Smith, Ottawa; Carey Smith (Desiree), Bowmanville; and great-grandfather of Grady Ford. Step-father of Dawn, Karen & Allan Sylvester; and step-grandfather of Christine, Sarah, Michael & Rayne. Brother of Joy Gess (late Myron), South Carolina, USA. Predeceased by brother James Ford. Also survived by many nieces and nephews. Memorial Visitation at the MALCOLM, DEAVITT & BINHAMMER FUNERAL HOME, 141 Renfrew St., Pembroke on Tuesday from 2 to 4:00 and 7 to 9:00 p.m. Memorial Service will be held in Calvin United Church, Pembroke on Wednesday, September 1, 2010 at 11:00 a.m. Interment of Ashes in Calvin United Cemetery. Members of the Masonic Lodge A.F. & A.M. #128 Pembroke are requested to assemble at the Funeral Home for Service Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. As an expression of sympathy, donations to Calvin United Church, Red Cross, Shriners Hospitals for Children, or the Charity of your Choice would be appreciated.) Online condolences and donations are available at .

Published online August 28, 2010

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
